intro: Michelia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf michelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Magnoliaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its large, ovate leaves that can grow up to 20 centimeters in length. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and showy blossoms. Michelia macrophylla prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it suitable for shaded garden environments.
